title: Album Page, "Architectural Sketches, Soissons and Laon", May 27, 1888
medium: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
markings: Paper-maker's mark: embossed upper left corner in oval shield: BRISTOL (on banner) / L M.
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: 39; lower right corner 35; to right of cupola drawing: This was a very / pretty cupola on / the Hotel Dieu but / it is very badly expressed / Soissons / May 27th 1888; below turret drawing: corner at Laon / with Kenyon / May 27th 1888.
description: Vertical sheet with two sketches of architectural elements.  At left is a short tower rising from a roofline.  The tower has flattened double arches which are louvered, an an ogee cupola faceted steeple with finial and weathervane above.  At right is the corner of a building ending in a gabled roof that has only been partially rendered.  At the corner of the roof is a gutter and turret with a small window, and lower roof with window below it.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Architectural Sketches, Soissons and Laon", May 27, 1888.Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-207.
